name: Xero
description: Global cloud-based accounting software platform for small and medium-sized businesses.
notability: NZ's largest tech company by market cap. Globally recognized brand.
evidence: Announced plans to cut up to 800 jobs in March 2023. Despite this, the careers page shows ongoing hiring in NZ.

name: Fisher & Paykel Healthcare
description: A leading designer, manufacturer, and marketer of products for respiratory care, surgery, and sleep apnea treatment.
notability: NZ's second-largest tech company by market cap. Operates in over 120 countries.
evidence: No recent layoff news was found; the company is focused on its growth trajectory.

name: Datacom Group
description: New Zealand's largest IT services company, providing digital solutions, cloud services, and data centers.
notability: Consistently ranked as NZ's largest tech company by the TIN200 index.
evidence: Headcount reduced by 12% in the year to 2024, citing AI-driven efficiencies. The careers page still lists multiple technical roles.

name: Rocket Lab
description: Provides end-to-end space services, including launch services for small satellites and spacecraft manufacturing.
notability: Winner of the PwC Hi-Tech Company of the Year 2024. A globally significant player in the commercial space industry.
evidence: The company's careers portal lists numerous open roles for its Neutron rocket program.

name: Halter
description: Develops solar-powered smart collars and a software platform for virtual fencing and herd management.
notability: Winner of the 2024 Deloitte Fast 50 with 1,539% revenue growth. Recently achieved 'unicorn' status.
evidence: The careers page shows a large number of open positions in New Zealand across nearly all departments.

name: Spark NZ
description: A leading New Zealand telecommunications and digital services provider.
notability: One of NZ's largest listed companies by market cap. Ranked as a top graduate employer.
evidence: Announced restructuring and job cuts in March 2024 due to a 'tough operating environment'.

name: Trimble
description: A global leader in positioning technologies (GPS, laser, optical) for various industries.
notability: Ranked #1 most popular technology graduate employer in NZ. Operates a major R&D hub in Christchurch.
evidence: The careers portal shows multiple open positions in Christchurch.

name: Vista Group
description: Provides comprehensive software solutions for the global film industry.
notability: A leading global player in its niche, listed on the NZX.
evidence: Announced a restructuring in July 2023 resulting in laying off 6-8% of its global workforce.

name: Orion Health
description: Develops a digital healthcare platform for patient data consolidation and care coordination.
notability: A long-standing, globally recognized NZ HealthTech company. Recently acquired by HEALWELL AI.
evidence: The recent acquisition was stated to have no immediate staff impacts. The careers page shows open roles.

name: Serko
description: Provides an online travel booking and expense management platform for businesses.
notability: Listed on the NZX and ASX. CMO named NZ Tech Marketer of the Year 2023.
evidence: The careers page lists several open senior engineering roles in Auckland.

name: Gentrack Group
description: Provides essential software for energy and water utilities and airports.
notability: Top-ranking NZ tech company by revenue. Listed on NZX and ASX.
evidence: The company appears to have stabilized after past challenges. No recent layoff news found.

name: EROAD
description: Offers technology solutions for fleet management, including GPS tracking and electronic road user charges.
notability: A prominent NZX-listed tech company with high forecast earnings growth.
evidence: The careers page lists open roles in New Zealand. No recent layoff news found.

name: Pushpay
description: Provides a donor management system and church management software, primarily for the faith sector.
notability: A significant NZ-founded tech company, though now heavily US-focused.
evidence: The careers page lists an open role in Auckland for a Senior Site Reliability Engineer.

name: Cin7
description: Provides a cloud-based inventory management platform for retailers and wholesalers.
notability: Winner of the PwC Hi-Tech Company of the Year 2023.
evidence: Announced layoffs affecting 15% of its workforce in April 2023.

name: Gallagher NZ
description: A global company specializing in animal management, security, and fuel systems.
notability: A major, long-standing NZ company with a global presence.
evidence: No specific layoff news for its NZ tech divisions was found.

name: Rakon
description: Designs and manufactures advanced frequency control and timing solutions.
notability: A key player in NZ's deep tech sector, listed on the NZX.
evidence: The company cut 45 staff from its Auckland workforce in a past restructuring.

name: Serato
description: A world-leading developer of audio software for DJs and music producers.
notability: A globally recognized brand in the music technology industry, recently acquired by Tiny.
evidence: The careers page lists several open roles, including a graduate program.

name: LawVu
description: Provides a legal workspace platform for in-house corporate legal teams.
notability: A rapidly growing scale-up in the legal tech space.
evidence: The careers page shows an open role for a Technical Lead.

notability: Winner of both Hi-Tech Startup of the Year and Most Innovative Software Solution in 2024.
evidence: As a recent award-winning startup, it is likely in a growth phase.

name: Tracksuit
description: A brand tracking and marketing analytics platform.
notability: Winner of the Hi-Tech Emerging Company of the Year 2024.
evidence: As a recent award-winning emerging company, it is likely focused on growth.

description: Global software and cloud services provider.
notability: Ranked as a top graduate employer.
evidence: Reports of significant NZ layoffs in 2023.

name: Amazon
description: E-commerce and cloud computing giant (AWS).
notability: Ranked as a top graduate employer in NZ.
evidence: Global layoffs occurred, but specific large-scale NZ impact less clear. Hiring continues for specific roles.

name: Sharesies
